abstract.p: Comment on handcrafted candles, made by dipping technique used by Premontres monks, that are manufactured by Ciergerie des Premontres in Provence, France (Currents); photo (S)

block.p: The handcrafted candles, left, narrower at the tip, are made by dipping, a technique of the Premontres monks, which forms even layers of wax from the wick outward. Ciergerie des Premontres is among the last French companies to make candles in the old style. Colors and sizes to order. An ivory candle, less than an inch in diameter and almost eight inches high, is about 20 cents. Visitors can see candles made. Shipping, (011) 33-4-90-95-71-14; e-mail to dubois.emmanuelle@voila.fr; Ciergerie des Premontres, 2, avenue Francois Atger, Graveson.
